definition: surname Piao/Korean surname (Park, Pak, or Bak)/also pr. [Pu2]

sentences.english: Certainly, the government itself is not about to start making a fetish of frugality.
sentences.chinese: 当然政府自身不打算做艰苦朴素的榜样。

sentences.english: Hard work and plain living is a cherished heritage of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 艰苦朴素的作风是中国人民的传家宝。

sentences.english: Plain living and hard working are the fine qualities of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 艰苦朴素是中华民族的优良品质。

sentences.english: This veteran cadre still remains his philosophy of hard work and plain-living.
sentences.chinese: 这位老干部仍然保持着艰苦朴素的作风。

sentences.english: Nowadays, it is hard to find the spirit of hard work and plain living in some people.
sentences.chinese: 现如今在一些人身上很难觅到艰苦朴素的精神。

sentences.english: We must keep to the style of hard work and plain living.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须保持艰苦朴素的作风。

sentences.english: The contents and forms of the education must conform to the demands of times …
sentences.chinese: 同时，应当开展艰苦朴素的传统教育。

sentences.english: He decided to turn over a new leaf. He would live simply and regain the respect of his family.
sentences.chinese: 他决定改过自新，艰苦朴素，重新得到家人的尊敬。

sentences.english: You must live up to hard work and plain living.
sentences.chinese: 你必须按艰苦朴素的标准去生活。

sentences.english: He learnt anew the value of hard work and frugality, which benefited him throughout his life.
sentences.chinese: 他重新懂得了艰苦朴素的价值，终生受益。

definition: hardworking and thrifty in running one's household
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
